name: Lists revisited
intro: Self-reducing lists are all fun and games, but it many applications (such as the LISP family)
simplicity and observability and more practical.
So here comes the linked list: each node is either a pair of (value, next)
- traditionally denoted cons - or a nil.

content.title: Fold
descr: Implement fold: fold [a, b, ... z] f x = f a (f b (... (f z x) ...)).
More specifically, fold nil f x = x
and fold (V a b) f x = f a (fold b f x).
Note that is you reuse lst and nil from the previous chapter,
you could care less about what f and x are.
cases: V=BC(CI); fold (V a b) f x
